goodsky
Class gs

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      goodsky.gs
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class gs
extends javax.swing.JFrame

This is the main class for the GoodSky Game Library. This class is not meant to be very object oriented, in fact this class contains primarily static methods for the user to use. This helps learning Java students so they can get started making games sooner, and hopefully keep them entertained with programming to improve their skills.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

gs

public gs()
Constructor: Sets up the swing window and canvas. User does not have to call this.

Method Detail

start

public static void start()
A static function call that will populate the base field. It is required to make this function call before you do anything else with the library.

gameloop

public static boolean gameloop()
Use this to make your main game loop

Returns:
this will return true when the program is still running and false once the program is complete

sync

public static void sync()
This will render all our game objects to the screen and wait a certain amount to keep stable FPS. NOTE: You MUST call this function in your main game loop for ANYTHING to happen.

setFPS

public static void setFPS(int fps)
Sets the desired frames per second

getFPS

public static double getFPS()
This function tells you what the current Frames per Second is of the project.

Returns:
an integer estimating the frames per second

add an object to the render list

Parameters:
obj - object to be rendered

Parameters:
obj - object to be removed

                                 int height)

Parameters:
width -

setScreenTitle

public static void setScreenTitle(java.lang.String title)

setBackgroundColor

public static void setBackgroundColor(java.awt.Color c)
Set the background color of the screen.

Parameters:
c - the color you wish to change the background to. e.g. Color.BLUE

setBackgroundOff

public static void setBackgroundOff()
Only use this command if you really know what you are doing.

setBackgroundImage

public static void setBackgroundImage(java.lang.String filename)
Set the background image if you choose to use an image for the background. NOTE: if you want to remove a background you can always set the image to null.

Parameters:
filename - The path to the file you want to make the background. e.g. "background.bmp"

setCameraPosition

public static void setCameraPosition(int x,
                                     int y)
Position the virtual camera at position x and y. The camera can not go below 0,0 or beyond backgroundimage.width - stage.width, backgroundimage.height - stage.height.

Parameters:
x - Position of the camera in x (top left corner)
y - Position of the camera in y (top left corner)

TitleScreen

public static void TitleScreen(java.lang.String imagefile)
This will put up a title screen using the image supplied. This is only the most simple title screen, if you wish for a title menu with more advanced functionality then you will have to write your own. Once you click on the screen the function will exit and continue on to your game.

Parameters:
imagefile - Make this your title image. It should be the same size as the screen, otherwise you may get some strange results.

exit

public static void exit()
Stop the program and exit

getArrowKey

public static boolean getArrowKey(int keycode)
Returns if one of the arrow keys is down.

Parameters:
keycode - The key to check e.g. GoodSky.LEFT_ARROW
Returns:
true if the key is down. false if the key is not down.

public static boolean getKey(char letter)
Returns if one of the character keys is down.

Parameters:
letter - The character you want to see if it is down. e.g. 'W'
Returns:
true if the key is down. false if the key is not down.

                        int x,
                        int y)
Print text to screen. Useful for debugging tests.

Parameters:
msg - What you want to print to the screen
x - the x position to print to the screen
